content: Can anyone point me in the direction of a resource example that makes use of a "complex" extension. - Thanks

@Richard Kavanagh QICore Encounter is an interesting example:
http://fhir2.healthintersections.com.au/qicore/qicore-encounter.html
This profile overridens constraints on complex extension elements.
Thanks @Michel Rutten that's useful but it was an actual XML instance example I was looking for.

This is an example resource for the above profile:
http://hl7.org/fhir/2016May/qicore%5Cencounter-example-qicore.xml.html

Hi Richard, for the Dutch nl-core-patient there are also some complex extensions in use. You can find the nl-core-patient profile and example here: https://simplifier.net/NL-BasicComponents/nl-core-patient
Thanks you both @Michel Rutten @Ardon Toonstra

Can you have a complex extension within a complex extension?
I have been able to create an examplar using the HAPI API but unable to model it using Forge.

You can have complex estensions 50 levels deep if you really want to. Forge should support it, though I haven't tried to exercise that capability. Perhaps raise the issue with a screen-shot on the Conformance stream.
Thanks. I believe it could be a limitation. I'll contact them.
